Posts.Content: HappyOwl wrote: I am new to this community, but my surgery was just over a year ago (bilateral mastectomy). Finished all treatments in December 2014. I still have regular itching/tingling near my scar areas and under my arm where lymph nodes were removed. I've tried benadryl and every type of lotion/cream/etc including prescription strength cortisone cream. One small under arm area is now red and almost feels like a small bump......which is most likely worse because I keep scratching and clawing at myself. I had silicone implants put in at the time of my mastectomy so I did not have tissue expanders. Parts of the scar area also itch and tingle almost non-stop. Has anyone else had experience like this? Dx 3/2014, IDC, Right, 1cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 2, 6/17 nodes, ER+/PR+ Surgery 4/17/2014 Lymph node removal: Right, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (left): Nipple reconstruction, Silicone implant; Reconstruction (right): Nipple reconstruction, Silicone implant Chemotherapy 6/19/2014 AC + T (Taxol) Radiation Therapy 11/17/2014 Breast, Lymph nodes, Chest wall Hormonal Therapy Arimidex (anastrozole) Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2015 11:09PM HappyOwl wrote: I am just one year out, stage 3a. I am loving reading the encouragement here and also realizing that I am not alone in how I feel. Well meaning people expect that I should be perfectly fine and "back to normal" since everything is done, but in no way have I defined a "new normal" yet. Some days are better than others; being busy helps, but not a day goes back that I am not reminded about my cancer and the anxiety about recurrances. Intellectually, I believe I will be fine and I know there is new research being done every day, but emotionally it's another story. Thanks for the support everyone!
